B1 unexpectedly or in a way that is unusual: The restaurant turned out to be surprisingly cheap. Not surprisingly, the jury found them guilty.
More examplesFewer examplesThe journey was surprisingly hassle-free.Many teenagers are surprisingly ignorant about current politics.Letters of complaint were surprisingly few in number .For such a famous, wealthy man, his personal life was surprisingly simple and ordinary.Not surprisingly, this excuse was too much for them to swallow.
